We are pushing out a small number of bug fixes tonight
These fixes are:
1. In legacy (non-TSX) mode, shadows are influenced by camera position
2. TS2012 fails to run if Pixel shader 2 is installed. (However,it will only work in legacy mode)
3. Fix to problem of Horseshoe Curve DLC crashing if saved at certain places
4. Terrain editor has invalid option removed
5. Editor crashing due to stencil shadow missing
We're in the final stages of fixing the ".net 4" problem, which, subject to final testing, we plan to release tomorrow.

For all of you that have problems with errors and shut downs etc. I got those errors too but try this, this is how I did and it works now..

Before you start, uninstall the game if you've installed it already and delete the RailSimulator.com folder.

_____________________

1. Mount sr-r3ts12

2. Install as normal, tick all the extra installations as .NET FW 4, PhysX, Adobe Flash Player etc. (it probably wont install them since you've mounted the image file so if you get errors when installing all those programs just click OK and move on)

3. Go to the the installation folder and into the Install folder. Install all programs in this order (!!Run as admin if you can!!)
-vcredist_x86
-PhysX
-Adobe Flash Player
-Direct X9
-.NET 4.0
After you've installed .NET 4.0 you'll have to restart your computer, DO SO!

5. Download the updates for RW 3 which can be found here http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6707854/Railworks_3_Train_Simulator_2012_Deluxe_Update_1_and_2-SKIDROW

6. Run the update (as admin) and install to your main Railworks directory

7. Open the mounted ISO file (sr-r3ts12) inside that you'll find the SKIDROW folder. Copy ONLY the Railworks.exe and paste it and replace it into you main Railworks folder. 

8. Open the folder with the update that you downloaded. Open the SKIDROW folder. Copy and replace ALL files from there into your main Railworks folder.

9. Start the game with Railworks.exe and enjoy the game

________________________

Hope this solves the problem for some of you out there.

@Giancarlo1001: have you checked that you are using the latest graphic card drivers? If you can load the initial screen, which has package manager and the other stuff, the problem is probably not with the game itself. Have you tried whether or not the previous version, RailWorks 2 (also available here), works on your computer? Did you run the setup as administrator? What antivirus/firewall package are you using? Have you already tried to set it to "game mode" (or chosen some other silent option without "are you sure you want to allow railworks.exe to run on this computer" popups, which could cause the game to crash) before running the game?

analjuggern4ut: I downloaded RW2 with skidrow and works perfect. RW3 is the one that keeps crashing when i click on Start Railworks 2012. I use McAfee and already tried turning off the antivirus and firewall

@Giancarlo1001: if you check "settings", the second tab on the launch screen, try to uncheck "Train Simulator 2012 Game Engine Technology" and then press "Start Train Simulator 2012". Does that make any difference? And, did you apply the Update 1 and 2 pack, available as a separate torrent?

http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6707854/Railworks_3_Train_Simulator_2012_Deluxe_Update_1_and_2-SKIDROW

You could also try to uncheck "Full Screen" and set the basic settings option to "Low" as that turns off most of the extra graphics options. If you can load the game that way, then try "medium" basic settings before moving back to "high". You could also try to move the Anti-Aliasing slider to left. 

I am using a quad-core Phenom II CPU and a Radeon HD 6870 graphics card and the game runs perfectly with "high" settings with the new graphics engine as long as "Multi-Core" option is enabled on the settings tab (the launcher does not remember this setting, so I have to check it manually every time I launch the game). However, the latest ATI Catalyst (11.8) drivers seem to have some stability issues, so I reverted back to Catalyst 11.7 drivers.
Make sure you install all the supplementary software. Check your resolution settings as well. Just because you can't get it working doesn't make those of us who can dumb.

if have problem with black screen and return to menu..

1. uninstall train simulator 2012
2. delete installation folder (c\:prog~\ railworks.com)
3. open regedit, and find for "railworks 3" or "railworks" if don't have any previous game. delete any found related object and value. find next and repeat.
4. mount and install the game normally
5. in the end of installation, add marks to:
-vcredist_x86
-PhysX
-Adobe Flash Player
-Direct X9
-.NET 4.0 (restart required)
skip if u have already any of them installed
4. download SKIDROW update 1 and 2
5. install those update (run as admin..)
6. mount sr-r3ts12.iso, copy file ONLY RailWorks.exe to installation folder. paste and replace
7. Last step, open SKIDROW folder from updates, copy ALL the files (install_flashplayer10_chrd_aih.exe, LocalisedStrings.dll, steamclient.dll, dan SKIDROW.ini)
8. Run the GAME (railworks.exe as admin..)

** Fix **

I was having an issue with the game crashing upon running it from the launcher. Tried changing all the possible settings options on the off chance it was configured improperly - didn't help.

What fixed it was:

Uninstalling - and deleting the original install directory file.

Reinstalling - At the end of the install check all of the additional game component options for installation. [directx, physx, ect]

Copying ONLY the following files to the game directory: LocalisedStrings.dll, RailWorks.exe, Skidrow.ini, **AND** Steamclient.dll

Don't copy steam_api.dll

Didn't need the update files to get it working. Thanks whoever the OP of that fix was.

install guide:

1. mount the .iso in daemon tools
2. run setup file.
3. in the setup check all additional software, if u dont hawe then(but C++ is requaired for the game to launch)
4. copy contents of skidrow folder into game folder
5. run the game.
6.(optional) if u have problems both in te launcher or ingame, down and apply skidrow up 1&2(mentioned above), update drivers for you vga card(important!), do the system update(windows), if vista/7 is in place, run launcher with admin  privilegies(necessary!)(find it in propert. of shortcut, on the compatibility tab)
7. support game dev here: http://www.railsimulator.com/products.php

Had a few problems to start but they were very easily fixed. D3dx9_43.dll was missing which a simple update / reinstall of directx fixes. I had another popup I think similar to that occured but the fix was just as easy / the same.

Then the program would run but then after the screen going blank, reverts back to the original screen closing the game without any error messages. The simple update of 1&2 fixes this. (See links before)
